ch.aplu.android

Class GGBitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.GGBitmap

  • public class GGBitmap
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that holds a Bitmap to draw graphics elements and provide some static helper methods for image loading and transformation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GGBitmap(int width, int height)
      Creates a GGBitmap with given number of horizontal and vertical pixels that holds a Bitmap instance to draw graphics elements.
      GGBitmap(int width, int height, int bgColor)
      Creates a GGBitmap with given number of horizontal and vertical pixels that holds a Bitmap instance to draw graphics elements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GGBitmap

        public GGBitmap(int width,
        int height)
        Creates a GGBitmap with given number of horizontal and vertical pixels that holds a Bitmap instance to draw graphics elements. The coordinates for the drawing methods are 0..width-1, 0..height-1 with zero at upper left corner. The background is Color.BLACK
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the Bitmap in pixels
        height - the height of the Bitmap in pixels

      • GGBitmap

        public GGBitmap(int width,
        int height,
        int bgColor)
        Creates a GGBitmap with given number of horizontal and vertical pixels that holds a Bitmap instance to draw graphics elements. The coordinates for the drawing methods are 0..width-1, 0..height-1 with zero at upper left corner.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the Bitmap in pixels
        height - the height of the Bitmap in pixels
        bgColor - the color of the background

    • Method Detail

      • getZoomedImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getZoomedImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                     double factor)
        Returns the bitmap scaled by the given factor.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the original image bitmap
        factor - the zoom factor (>1 zoom-in, <1 zoom-out)
        Returns:
        the transformed image bitmap

      • getZoomedImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getZoomedImage(java.lang.String filename,
                                     double factor)
        Returns the bitmap from the give file scaled by the given factor. From the given filename the image file in searched in the following order:
        - - filename contains a colon : searched at URL in format http://...
        - filename contains slash or backslash : search on sdcard ("/sdcard/" appended)
        - otherwise if contains no dot, searched in app package, else search on sdcard
        e.g. if neither a dot nor a slash, searched from res/drawable resource folder
        Parameters:
        filename - the path or URL to the image file
        factor - the zoom factor (>1 zoom-in, <1 zoom-out)
        Returns:
        the transformed image bitmap

      • getRotatedImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getRotatedImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                      double angle)
        Returns the bitmap rotated by the given angle.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the original image bitmap
        angle - the rotation angle (in degrees clockwise)
        Returns:
        the transformed image bitmap

      • getRotatedImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getRotatedImage(java.lang.String filename,
                                      double angle)
        Returns the bitmap from the give file rotated by the given angle. From the given filename the image file in searched in the following order:
        - - filename contains a colon : searched at URL in format http://...
        - filename contains slash or backslash : search on sdcard ("/sdcard/" appended)
        - otherwise if contains no dot, searched in app package, else search on sdcard
        e.g. if neither a dot nor a slash, searched from res/drawable resource folder
        Parameters:
        filename - the path or URL to the image file
        angle - the rotation angle (in degrees clockwise)
        Returns:
        the transformed image bitmap

      • getScaledImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getScaledImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                     double factor,
                                     double angle)
        Returns the bitmap scaled by the given factor and rotated by the given angle.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the original image bitmap
        factor - the zoom factor (>1 zoom-in, <1 zoom-out)
        angle - the rotation angle (in degrees clockwise)
        Returns:
        the transformed image bitmap

      • getScaledImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getScaledImage(java.lang.String filename,
                                     double factor,
                                     double angle)
        Returns the bitmap from the give file scaled by the given factor and rotated by the given angle. From the given filename the image file in searched in the following order:
        - - filename contains a colon : searched at URL in format http://...
        - filename contains slash or backslash : search on sdcard ("/sdcard/" appended)
        - otherwise if contains no dot, searched in app package, else search on sdcard
        e.g. if neither a dot nor a slash, searched from res/drawable resource folder
        Parameters:
        filename - the path or URL to the image file
        factor - the zoom factor (>1 zoom-in, <1 zoom-out)
        angle - the rotation angle (in degrees clockwise)
        Returns:
        the transformed image bitmap

      • floodFill

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap floodFill(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                android.graphics.Point pt,
                                int oldColor,
                                int newColor)
        Fills a bounded single-colored region with the given color. The given point is part of the region and used to specify it.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the bitmap containing the connected region
        pt - a point inside the region
        oldColor - the old color of the region
        newColor - the new color of the region
        Returns:
        the bitmap with the transformed region

      • getBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap(java.lang.String filename)
        Loads the image from given image file and returns the Bitmap reference for this image. From the given filename the image file in searched in the following order:
        - filename contains a colon : searched at URL in format http://...
        - filename contains slash or backslash : search on sdcard ("/sdcard/" appended)
        - otherwise if contains no dot, searched in app package, else search on sdcard
        e.g. if neither a dot nor a slash, searched from res/drawable resource folder
        Parameters:
        filename - the path or URL to the image file

        public android.graphics.Canvas getCanvas()
        Returns a Canvas reference of the current background.
        Returns:
        the Canvas reference of the background

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap()
        Returns the bitmap attributed to this GGBitmap.
        Returns:
        the bitmap used for this GGBitmap

        Parameters:

      • clear

        public void clear(int color)
        Sets the background color to the given color and clears the frame buffer by painting it with the given color. Draws an available background image and the grid lines into the frame buffer.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the frame buffer by painting it with the current background color. Draws an available background image and the grid lines into the frame buffer.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(int x1,
            int y1,
            int x2,
            int y2)
        Draws a line from one coordinate pair to another coordinate pair. The line width and color is determined by setLineWidth() and setPaintColor().
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x-coordinate of the start point
        y1 - the y-coordinate of the start point
        x2 - the x-coordinate of the endpoint
        y2 - the y-coordinate of the endpoint

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(android.graphics.Point pt1,
            android.graphics.Point pt2)
        Draws a line from one coordinate pair to another coordinate pair. The line width and color is determined by setLineWidth() and setPaintColor().
        Parameters:
        pt1 - the start point
        pt2 - the endpoint

        public void drawRectangle(android.graphics.Point pt1,
                 android.graphics.Point pt2)
        Draws a rectangle with given opposite corners.
        Parameters:
        pt1 - upper left vertex of the rectangle
        pt2 - lower right vertex of the rectangle

      • fillRectangle

        public void fillRectangle(android.graphics.Point pt1,
                 android.graphics.Point pt2)
        Draws a filled rectangle with given opposite corners. (The filling includes the complete outline of the rectangle.)
        Parameters:
        pt1 - upper left vertex of the rectangle
        pt2 - lower right vertex of the rectangle

      • drawArc

        public void drawArc(android.graphics.Point pt,
           int radius,
           double startAngle,
           double extendAngle)
        Draws an arc with given center, radius, start and end angle.
        Parameters:
        pt - the center of the arc
        radius - the radius of the arc
        startAngle - the start angle in degrees (zero to east, positive counterclockwise)
        extendAngle - the extend angle in degrees (zero to east, positive counterclockwise)

      • fillArc

           int radius,
           double startAngle,
           double extendAngle)
        Fills an arc with given center, radius, start and end angle.
        Parameters:
        pt - the center of the arc
        radius - the radius of the arc
        startAngle - the start angle in degrees (zero to east, positive counterclockwise)
        extendAngle - the extendAngle in degrees (zero to east, positive counterclockwise)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Displays the given text at the given position using the current font.
        Parameters:

        pt - the start point of the text baseline
